<<<api>>>: Generics
<<<code>>>: class MyIterator<T> implements Iterator<T> {
private List<T> list = // Get the list from an external source.
private int index = 0;
public T next() {
T element = list.get(index++);
// Do some processing.
return element;
}
// The other methods of Iterator are easy to implement.
}

You can use the type parameter T to specify the type of elements in the list, and the compiler will generate the appropriate code for each type. So you can use MyIterator<T> to return an iterator of any type of elements.

<<<explanation>>>: By using the type parameter T, you can specify the type of elements in the list, and the compiler will generate the appropriate code for each type. This allows you to use the same iterator class for different types of elements without having to write separate classes for each type.
